  "description": "Primesage is well-positioned to provide all-inclusive HR solutions that improve employee productivity and corporate efficacy. Through a comprehensive range of services created to meet the many demands of businesses in a cutthroat industry, the company hopes to assist companies in Nigeria and abroad in optimizing their human resources. For nearly ten years, Primesage has been providing prestigious clients with customized services. We provide corporate team building events, talent management, recruitment services, and training and human capital development programs for both technical and managerial abilities. In addition to our faculty&#39;s vast industrial expertise in human resources management, we have a group of specialists in particular fields who work with companies in a wide range of industries.

With the support and direction of our multifaceted organization, Primesage collaborates with businesses as a smart partnership, offering practical solutions to assist address daily business difficulties by developing their human resources. We advocate a holistic approach, integrating ourselves into our clients&#39; businesses and learning as much as we can about their operations and difficulties. We want to help businesses fulfill their demands and, more importantly, reach their objectives of maintaining their competitive edge and boosting their bottom line outcomes.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive - Sales

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the BDE - Sales, you will be responsible for developing and executing strategic sales initiatives that drive revenue growth and establish our firm as a leader in digital transformation.
	You will work closely with consultants to provide value-driven solutions to clients, ensuring the firm consistently exceeds market expectations.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement innovative sales strategies to drive business growth and meet revenue targets.
	Identify and penetrate new markets, industries, and customer segments.
	Negotiate and close high-value contracts while aligning solutions with client needs.
	Oversee customer engagement efforts, ensuring satisfaction and repeat business.
	Work closely with consultants and technical teams to deliver optimal digital transformation solutions to clients.
	Build and manage a robust sales pipeline, ensuring efficient deal closures.
	Foster strategic partnerships to enhance business opportunities and revenue streams.
	Manage key client engagements, ensuring excellent service delivery and long-term business relationships.
	Monitor industry trends, competitor activities, and market conditions to develop sales strategies.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5+ years of experience in Technology/ERP solutions and digital transformation sales.
	Strong Technology Sales skills with a proven ability to drive revenue growth.
	Proficiency in CRM tools, sales analytics, and customer engagement strategies.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship-building skills.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, target-driven environment.


Compensation and Incentives
Why You Should Apply?


	Opportunity to be part of a top-tier sales team and drive industry-changing projects.
	Work in a dynamic environment at the forefront of digital transformation.
	Competitive compensation and growth opportunities.
	A culture of innovation, excellence, and collaboration.


Method of Application

We advocate a holistic approach, integrating ourselves into our clients' businesses and learning as much as we can about their operations and difficulties. We want to help businesses fulfill their demands and, more importantly, reach their objectives of maintaining their competitive edge and boosting their bottom line outcomes.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive - Sales

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the BDE - Sales, you will be responsible for developing and executing strategic sales initiatives that drive revenue growth and establish our firm as a leader in digital transformation.
	You will work closely with consultants to provide value-driven solutions to clients, ensuring the firm consistently exceeds market expectations.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement innovative sales strategies to drive business growth and meet revenue targets.
	Identify and penetrate new markets, industries, and customer segments.
	Negotiate and close high-value contracts while aligning solutions with client needs.
	Oversee customer engagement efforts, ensuring satisfaction and repeat business.
	Work closely with consultants and technical teams to deliver optimal digital transformation solutions to clients.
	Build and manage a robust sales pipeline, ensuring efficient deal closures.
	Foster strategic partnerships to enhance business opportunities and revenue streams.
	Manage key client engagements, ensuring excellent service delivery and long-term business relationships.
	Monitor industry trends, competitor activities, and market conditions to develop sales strategies.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5+ years of experience in Technology/ERP solutions and digital transformation sales.
	Strong Technology Sales skills with a proven ability to drive revenue growth.
	Proficiency in CRM tools, sales analytics, and customer engagement strategies.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship-building skills.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, target-driven environment.


Compensation and Incentives
Why You Should Apply?


	Opportunity to be part of a top-tier sales team and drive industry-changing projects.
	Work in a dynamic environment at the forefront of digital transformation.

Sales and Marketing Personnel Job at Bluenix Paint Manufacturing Limited




        
    

        
        Bluenix Paint Manufacturing Limited, founded in 2024, is a forward-thinking paint production company committed to innovation, sustainability, and superior quality. Located in Dei Dei, AMAC Area Council, FCT-Abuja, we are redefining Nigeria’s paint industry by offering high-performance and durable paints designed for both residential and commercial applications.

At Bluenix, we go beyond traditional paint manufacturing by integrating advanced technology and research-driven formulations to create products that not only enhance aesthetics but also provide superior protection and longevity. Our commitment to excellence and customer satisfaction sets us apart as a trusted industry leader.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Sales and Marketing Personnel

Job Location: Amac, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	As a Marketing and Sales Personnel, you will be responsible for driving sales, increasing brand awareness, building customer relationships, and generating revenue for the company.


Key Responsibilities


	Promote and sell Bluenix paints and coatings to retail customers, construction companies, and project sites
	Identify new market opportunities and generate leads
	Meet monthly and quarterly sales targets
	Build and maintain relationships with customers and clients
	Conduct market research and competitor analysis
	Represent the company at promotional events, exhibitions, and client meetings
	Provide excellent after-sales service and support
	Collaborate with the marketing team on campaigns and strategies.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND / HND / BSc Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related fields
	At least 1 year of experience in sales or marketing (paint/industrial product sales is an advantage)
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Energetic, persuasive, and result-oriented
	Ability to work independently and within a team
	Must be based in Abuja or willing to relocate to Dei-Dei, Abuja.


What We Offer


	Monthly salary of N120,000
	Commission on every sale—the more you sell, the more you earn
	Professional growth opportunities
	Friendly and driven team environment
	A chance to grow with a visionary brand.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.bluenix@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

  "description": "Tamrose Limited is a leading integrated marine logistics and offshore support services provider, delivering innovative, reliable, and cost-effective solutions to clients in the oil &amp; gas, maritime, and industrial sectors. With a strong operational footprint and a focus on reliability, Tamrose has built a reputation for operational excellence, underpinned by industry best practices, skilled personnel, and continuous process improvement.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Employee Services Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	The Employee Services Officer will be responsible for managing day-to-day employee relations, delivering high-quality employee support services, and ensuring a positive workplace experience.
	This role will also manage the company&rsquo;s official social media channels, create engaging content, and drive digital engagement in alignment with Tamrose&rsquo;s brand and culture objectives.
	The ideal candidate will have a blend of HR operational experience and strong digital communication skills.


Key Responsibilities
Employee Services &amp; Relations:


	Manage and respond to day-to-day employee inquiries, complaints, and service requests in a timely manner.
	Ensure accurate and efficient processing of employee-related transactions (leave, benefits, onboarding, exit formalities, etc.).
	Maintain updated employee service records and ensure compliance with HR policies and procedures.
	Support HR initiatives, including wellness programs, engagement activities, and employee recognition efforts.


Digital Engagement &amp; Communication:


	Manage and monitor Tamrose&rsquo;s official social media channels (LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, etc.).
	Develop and post relevant, engaging content that reflects Tamrose&rsquo;s brand, values, and achievements.
	Drive online engagement and community interaction with targeted campaigns and initiatives.
	Track, analyze, and report on social media performance metrics.


Collaboration &amp; Reporting:


	Work closely with HR, Administration, and Corporate Communications teams to ensure alignment of employee services and communication efforts.
	Prepare periodic reports on employee service trends, feedback, and social media engagement for management review.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resources, Industrial Relations, Communications, or related field.
	4&ndash;6 years of experience in employee services, employee relations, or HR operations.
	Professional certification in HR (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, CIPD) or Communications is highly desirable.
	Prior experience in oil &amp; gas, large process or manufacturing, aviation, or maritime industries.
	Strong understanding of HR processes and employee engagement strategies.
	Proven ability to manage corporate social media accounts and create engaging digital content.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; familiarity with HRIS tools and social media analytics.


Key Competencies:


	Service orientation and customer focus
	Strong interpersonal relationship management
	Content creation and digital storytelling
	Conflict resolution and problem-solving
	Attention to detail and process discipline
	Data-driven decision-making


Method of Application
